trans-unit.source: Add Push Notifications to Apache Cordova App with Azure Mobile Apps | Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Add Push Notifications to Apache Cordova App with Azure Mobile Apps | Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Apps to send push notifications to your Apache Cordova app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Apps to send push notifications to your Apache Cordova app.

trans-unit.source: Add Push Notifications to your Apache Cordova App
trans-unit.target: Add Push Notifications to your Apache Cordova App

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add push notifications to the [Apache Cordova quick start] project so that every time a record is inserted, a
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add push notifications to the [Apache Cordova quick start] project so that every time a record is inserted, a

trans-unit.source: push notification is sent.
trans-unit.target: push notification is sent.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the [Apache Cordova quick start] tutorial, which you must complete first.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the [Apache Cordova quick start] tutorial, which you must complete first.

trans-unit.source: If
trans-unit.target: If

trans-unit.source: you have an ASP.NET backend and do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the push notification extension
trans-unit.target: you have an ASP.NET backend and do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the push notification extension

trans-unit.source: package to your project.
trans-unit.target: package to your project.

trans-unit.source: For more information about server extension packages, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps].
trans-unit.target: For more information about server extension packages, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps].

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial covers an Apache Cordova application being developed within Visual Studio 2015 and being run on the Google Android Emulator.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial covers an Apache Cordova application being developed within Visual Studio 2015 and being run on the Google Android Emulator.

trans-unit.source: You may additionally complete this tutorial on other emulators or devices and on different development platforms.
trans-unit.target: You may additionally complete this tutorial on other emulators or devices and on different development platforms.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: A [Google account] with a verified email address.
trans-unit.target: A [Google account] with a verified email address.

trans-unit.source: A PC with [Visual Studio Community 2015] or newer.
trans-unit.target: A PC with [Visual Studio Community 2015] or newer.

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio Tools for Apache Cordova].
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio Tools for Apache Cordova].

trans-unit.source: An [active Azure account](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: An [active Azure account](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: A completed [Apache Cordova quick start] project.
trans-unit.target: A completed [Apache Cordova quick start] project.

trans-unit.source: Completing other tutorials (like [authentication]) can happen first, but is not required.
trans-unit.target: Completing other tutorials (like [authentication]) can happen first, but is not required.

trans-unit.source: An Android device.
trans-unit.target: An Android device.

trans-unit.source: Although push notifications are supported on Android Emulators, we have found them to be unstable and do not recommend
trans-unit.target: Although push notifications are supported on Android Emulators, we have found them to be unstable and do not recommend

trans-unit.source: that you test push notifications on emulators.
trans-unit.target: that you test push notifications on emulators.

trans-unit.source: Create a Notification Hub
trans-unit.target: Create a Notification Hub

trans-unit.source: Enable Google Cloud Messaging
trans-unit.target: Enable Google Cloud Messaging

trans-unit.source: Since we are targetting the Google Android platform, you must enable Google Cloud Messaging.
trans-unit.target: Since we are targetting the Google Android platform, you must enable Google Cloud Messaging.

trans-unit.source: If you were targetting Apple iOS
trans-unit.target: If you were targetting Apple iOS

trans-unit.source: devices, you would enable APNS support.
trans-unit.target: devices, you would enable APNS support.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, if you were targetting Microsoft Windows devices, you would enable WNS or
trans-unit.target: Similarly, if you were targetting Microsoft Windows devices, you would enable WNS or

trans-unit.source: MPNS support.
trans-unit.target: MPNS support.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Mobile App backend to send push requests
trans-unit.target: Configure the Mobile App backend to send push requests

trans-unit.source: Update the server project to send push notifications
trans-unit.target: Update the server project to send push notifications

trans-unit.source: Configure your Android Device for USB Debugging
trans-unit.target: Configure your Android Device for USB Debugging

trans-unit.source: Before you can deploy your application to your Android Device, you need to enable USB Debugging.
trans-unit.target: Before you can deploy your application to your Android Device, you need to enable USB Debugging.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following
trans-unit.target: Perform the following

trans-unit.source: steps on your Android phone:
trans-unit.target: steps on your Android phone:

trans-unit.source: Go to **Settings** > **About phone**
trans-unit.target: Go to **Settings** > **About phone**

trans-unit.source: Tap on the **Build number** until developer mode is enabled
trans-unit.target: Tap on the **Build number** until developer mode is enabled

trans-unit.source: Return to **Settings**
trans-unit.target: Return to **Settings**

trans-unit.source: Select **Developer Options**
trans-unit.target: Select **Developer Options**

trans-unit.source: Turn on **USB debugging**
trans-unit.target: Turn on **USB debugging**

trans-unit.source: Connect your Android phone to your development PC with a USB Cable.
trans-unit.target: Connect your Android phone to your development PC with a USB Cable.

trans-unit.source: In testing this tutorial, we used a Google Nexus 5X running Android 6.0 (Marshmallow) release.
trans-unit.target: In testing this tutorial, we used a Google Nexus 5X running Android 6.0 (Marshmallow) release.

trans-unit.source: However, the techniques
trans-unit.target: However, the techniques

trans-unit.source: are common across any modern Android release.
trans-unit.target: are common across any modern Android release.

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your app

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that your Apache Cordova app project is ready to handle push notifications.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that your Apache Cordova app project is ready to handle push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Install the Apache Cordova Push Plugin
trans-unit.target: Install the Apache Cordova Push Plugin

trans-unit.source: Apache Cordova applications do not natively handle device or network capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Apache Cordova applications do not natively handle device or network capabilities.

trans-unit.source: These capabilities are provided
trans-unit.target: These capabilities are provided

trans-unit.source: by plugins that are published either on [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/) or on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: by plugins that are published either on [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/) or on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: The `phonegap-plugin-push` plugin is used to handle network push notifications.
trans-unit.target: The `phonegap-plugin-push` plugin is used to handle network push notifications.

trans-unit.source: You can install the push plugin in one of these ways:
trans-unit.target: You can install the push plugin in one of these ways:

trans-unit.source: From the command-prompt:
trans-unit.target: From the command-prompt:

trans-unit.source: From within Visual Studio:
trans-unit.target: From within Visual Studio:

trans-unit.source: Open the `config.xml` file from Solution Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Open the `config.xml` file from Solution Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Plugins** > **Custom**, select **Git** as the installation source, then enter `https://github.com/phonegap/phonegap-plugin-push` as the source.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Plugins** > **Custom**, select **Git** as the installation source, then enter `https://github.com/phonegap/phonegap-plugin-push` as the source.

trans-unit.source: Click on the arrow next to the installation source, then click on **Add**
trans-unit.target: Click on the arrow next to the installation source, then click on **Add**

trans-unit.source: The push plugin is now installed.
trans-unit.target: The push plugin is now installed.

trans-unit.source: Install Android Google Play Services
trans-unit.target: Install Android Google Play Services

trans-unit.source: The PhoneGap Push Plugin relies on Google Play Services for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: The PhoneGap Push Plugin relies on Google Play Services for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: To install:
trans-unit.target: To install:

trans-unit.source: Open **Visual Studio**
trans-unit.target: Open **Visual Studio**

trans-unit.source: Click on **Tools** > **Android** > **Android SDK Manager**
trans-unit.target: Click on **Tools** > **Android** > **Android SDK Manager**

trans-unit.source: Check the box next to each required SDK in the Extras folder that is not installed.
trans-unit.target: Check the box next to each required SDK in the Extras folder that is not installed.

trans-unit.source: The following packages are required:
trans-unit.target: The following packages are required:

trans-unit.source: Android Support Library version 23 or greater
trans-unit.target: Android Support Library version 23 or greater

trans-unit.source: Android Support Repository version 20 or greater
trans-unit.target: Android Support Repository version 20 or greater

trans-unit.source: Google Play Services version 27 or greater
trans-unit.target: Google Play Services version 27 or greater

trans-unit.source: Google Repository version 22 or greater
trans-unit.target: Google Repository version 22 or greater

trans-unit.source: Click on **Install Packages**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Install Packages**.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the installation to complete.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the installation to complete.

trans-unit.source: The current required libraries are listed in the [phonegap-plugin-push installation documentation].
trans-unit.target: The current required libraries are listed in the [phonegap-plugin-push installation documentation].

trans-unit.source: Register your Device for Push on startup
trans-unit.target: Register your Device for Push on startup

trans-unit.source: Add a call to **registerForPushNotifications** during the callback for the login process, or at the bottom of the **onDeviceReady** method:
trans-unit.target: Add a call to **registerForPushNotifications** during the callback for the login process, or at the bottom of the **onDeviceReady** method:

trans-unit.source: Add the new `registerForPushNotifications()` method as follows:
trans-unit.target: Add the new `registerForPushNotifications()` method as follows:

trans-unit.source: In the above code, replace `Your_Project_ID` with the numeric project ID for your app from the [Google Developer Console].
trans-unit.target: In the above code, replace `Your_Project_ID` with the numeric project ID for your app from the [Google Developer Console].

trans-unit.source: Test the app against the published mobile service
trans-unit.target: Test the app against the published mobile service

trans-unit.source: You can test the app by directly attaching an Android phone with a USB cable.
trans-unit.target: You can test the app by directly attaching an Android phone with a USB cable.

trans-unit.source: Instead of **Google Android Emulator**, select **Device**.
trans-unit.target: Instead of **Google Android Emulator**, select **Device**.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio will download the application to the device and run the application.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio will download the application to the device and run the application.

trans-unit.source: You will then interact with the application on the device.
trans-unit.target: You will then interact with the application on the device.

trans-unit.source: Improve your development experience.
trans-unit.target: Improve your development experience.

trans-unit.source: Screen sharing applications such as [Mobizen] can assist you in developing an Android application by projecting your Android screen on to a web browser on your PC.
trans-unit.target: Screen sharing applications such as [Mobizen] can assist you in developing an Android application by projecting your Android screen on to a web browser on your PC.

trans-unit.source: You can also test the Android app on the Android emulator.
trans-unit.target: You can also test the Android app on the Android emulator.

trans-unit.source: Remember to first add a Google account on the emulator.
trans-unit.target: Remember to first add a Google account on the emulator.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Read about [Notification Hubs] to learn about push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Read about [Notification Hubs] to learn about push notifications.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already done so, continue the tutorial by [Adding Authentication] to your Apache Cordova app.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already done so, continue the tutorial by [Adding Authentication] to your Apache Cordova app.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the SDKs.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the SDKs.

trans-unit.source: Apache Cordova SDK
trans-unit.target: Apache Cordova SDK

trans-unit.target: ASP.NET Server SDK

trans-unit.target: Node.js Server SDK
